DOCNAME: CASE OF ENGEL AND OTHERS v. THE NETHERLANDS (ARTICLE 50)
CONCLUSION: Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient
TEXT: CARDINAL . The only question remaining to be settled is that of the application of LAW ) in the present case . Thus , as regards the facts , the ORG can refer for the main points to paragraphs CARDINAL of its judgment of CARDINAL DATE ( ibid . , pp . DATE ) , confining itself here to giving some brief details .

CARDINAL . Mr. PERSON , Mr. PERSON , Mr. PERSON and Mr. PERSON do not allege that they have suffered any material damage , loss of income , legal expenses or other disbursements , but each of them claims a " purely symbolic " sum of MONEY ( CARDINAL ORG ) , presumably for moral damage .

CARDINAL . The ORG ’s delegates think that financial compensation " is due to Mr. PERSON for the breach of LAW para . CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) as such " ; they " suggest to the ORG that it should follow in this respect the method of calculation adopted in the PERSON case " ( judgment of DATE , Series A no . CARDINAL ) . On the other hand , the breach of Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL ) is said to have caused Mr. PERSON , Mr. PERSON and Mr. PERSON no " special damage " , with the result that " the decision referred to in item CARDINAL " of the operative provisions of the judgment of DATE would for these applications amount , " in itself " , to " just satisfaction within the meaning of LAW ) " .

CARDINAL . The Government ask the ORG to " fix the compensation , if any , on a purely symbolic sum " in the case of Mr. PERSON . They agree with the delegates as regards Mr. PERSON , Mr. PERSON and Mr. PERSON .
